summary: Valeriy Vladimirovich Kostikov was a Soviet employee, specifically a KGB officer, stationed in Mexico City. He is of interest due to his potential involvement with Lee Harvey Oswald during Oswald's visit to Mexico City in September and October 1963. The documents suggest Kostikov may have been involved in violent activities and possibly connected to Department 13. He is known to have handled Oswald's visa request to the Soviet Union. The documents span from 1962 to 1982, indicating ongoing interest and investigation into Kostikov's activities and connections.
significance: Valeriy Vladimirovich Kostikov's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in his alleged contact with Lee Harvey Oswald in Mexico City prior to the assassination. His role as a KGB officer and possible involvement in violent activities raise questions about potential Soviet involvement in the assassination. His handling of Oswald's visa request and suspected connections to Department 13, an alleged KGB unit for assassinations and sabotage, further fuel speculation about a possible conspiracy.
